alert.note: Alert for Coastal Martin; Inland Martin (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 16 at 4:00PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Martin County through 445 PM EDT... At 359 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles south of J And S Fish Camp, moving northeast at 20 mph. Additional strong storms will develop across Martin County through late afternoon. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Jupiter, Indiantown, Tequesta, Jupiter Island and Palm City. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or hard-topped vehicle. Remember, when thunder roars, go indoors! This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
